Wonder what the {{champion:28}} references will be for next patch, bet you we won't {{item:3361}} it coming.
I hope the entire thing has the same color as the background, so we have to select it to see.

Riot support tanks don't want Zeke's because it doesn't have health and since you nerfed Knight's Vow into an enchanter/early game jungler item and it's not a decent choice on support tanks anymore; we're now forced to prioritize high health items because it's what we scale off of and it's what Locket scales off of, and with Locket not having health or CDR it just further makes Zeke's a bad choice as Locket is far more impactful and essential to not getting reported. lol
If you put a Kindlegem into the recipe it would make the item a Hell of a lot more appealing and if you converted it to give 400-500 health instead of focusing on resistances it would definitely be worth taking. Likewise if you added CDR or Health to Locket it would take a lot of pressure off of Warden itemization who without a doubt have the worst itemization in the game and have almost no viable choices for what to build, forcing them to build the same thing every game with little room for variation.
Thank you for saying what needed to be said.
If only I hadn't been saying it since they released it.....lol

Aatrox is still a steaming pile of garbage. These buffs probably won't even push him to fringe relevancy in solo queue - let alone competitive play. He needs a complete overhaul to make him as cool in-game as he should be.
Dear god! we do not need anymore Yi skins... how about Taliya, Kindred, Ivern or Camille? At least Yoric's getting one I guess :\

Illaoi & Kled first, the rest later.

Also it'll probably be 2 patches after this for anything newer to come out.

I don't understand why Riot hates passive supports that stay in the back-line so much. Like, not everyone wants to be at the front line... if I wanted to play that way I'd just pick a second adc buy some wards and just focus on poking. I don't understand Janna's changes.. why in the world would you increase her damage and hinder her shield? People that play that type of champions like the strategy, the disengage, saving the adc when they mess up, enhancing and debuffing, not poking the enemy. Simply put, we like the "supporting" aspect of playing a support, but it feels like they want to make every support offensive... I absolutely hate this trend of forcing supports contribute to damaging the enemy. At one point we are just going to have 5 carries attacking each other and whoever has the most damage wins. 0 strategy. This to me is a step back from that season where they buffed supports and right now it is pretty discouraging.

Because champions that are designed to only play as a backline shield/heal bot is really boring and at times frustrating to play against. Some people enjoy the playstyle, but I can't think of a single time I was happy to see a Janna picked against me.
Because its tilting as assassin players to deal with a janna/lulu/soraka in the backline basically making you useless by pressing 1 to 2 buttons much interactive gameplay much wow
The Irony in this comment is that I'm not sure if you're referring to assassins or supports

It's not that there is anything wrong with being a backline-oriented champ (Soraka can still do that). But you need SOME complexity to your kit. You could do very well for yourself as janna by literally just brainlessly sitting in the backline and hitting e on cooldown on your ADC. Throw in a few instant Qs for some CC as well as ultis and you had an incredibly low skill cap champion with passive play that made it very hard to counter.

I played Janna quite a bit recently since it was so easy to win but it's not a fun champ to play as or against. You just get to sit there and watch as she spams massive shields on her ADC with nothing you could do about it.

Wow Yorick is getting a skin! Another meme has been put to rest.

You will remember Yorick's Skin.

Immediately scrolled down to...Nexus Siege. Booooo! One For All, URF, Hexakill. Just stop with all of the 'one and done' game modes, and put the big 3 on a permanent rotation. For a game and genre created from a custom game, you guys sure are stingy with your vault full of custom game modes that people want and aren't allowed to play.

So, the Janna changes ARE coming this patch. I feel they're a bit odd, as they're forcing a character who wants to stay back to get a forward a bit more but we'll see how they pan out.

Also, I've been gone a few seasons and was wondering why Riot now holds out on putting skins in the store right when the patch hits. When I played more (around season 3,4,5) they would release them almost immediately with the patch. Is there some context as to why this doesn't happen anymore?
The winds of change are coming, my friend.
Pretty sure Mundo's W is Burning Agony, not Infected Cleaver. Patch Typo?
Rip vayne and Janna 2017
vayne was peaking a bit too early for her hypercarry identity so riot is putting her back into late game god while toning down her mid game its a pretty good set of balance changes

> [{quoted}](name=Celestial Lion12,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=cdPxVfG3,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2017-09-26T19:11:36.274+0000)
>
> vayne was peaking a bit too early for her hypercarry identity so riot is putting her back into late game god while toning down her mid game its a pretty good set of balance changes

Putting her back into late game? Her q doesn't crit. She needs like 5 shots to kill squishy now.

Her base AA under the Q can still crit, she just can't crit the bonus damage (Hint, almost all champs can't crit the bonus damage on their AA-spells).

This pulls her away from her "1 shot the enemy laner with IE-Shiv" setup and more pushes her toward "Sustained threat that kills everything equally" side of things.

> [{quoted}](name=Steelflame,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=cdPxVfG3,comment-id=000b000000000001,timestamp=2017-09-26T21:20:28.808+0000)
>
> Her base AA under the Q can still crit, she just can't crit the bonus damage (Hint, almost all champs can't crit the bonus damage on their AA-spells).
> 
> This pulls her away from her "1 shot the enemy laner with IE-Shiv" setup and more pushes her toward "Sustained threat that kills everything equally" side of things.

she can't 1 shot. stop making shit up.

I'm not saying she can.  I'm saying it's pulling her farther from that (Because she USED to be able to do that about... 6 months ago?  9?  Not sure.), with the attempt to bring her toward what she overall should be, a target agnostic ADC who has solid self peel and 1v1 strength.
So ummm...  with new sword skin is janna an adc?  Cause imagine new janna full crit since a lot of crit items grant movement.
Especially with the new Celerity rune that grants 8% bonus move speed as AP or AD. lol

Why can't we ping:
Nasus Stacks
Veigar Stacks
Relic Shield Stacks
Ally Ultimate CDs from Portrait

BTW: I bought Kog years ago purely for AP Kog. Can I get a refund? It seems he's forgotten and only ADC is what Riot cares about (which I hate and has a totally different playstyle). To me, Kog was basically deleted after many seasons of AP Kog being a viable and unique pick.

Idk about you, but Ive been able to ping Relic Shield charges. I dont see any reason why you would ping your stacks as those champs, doesnt really benefit the team. 

There is zero reason why Riot would refund a champion you bought just because his kit was tweaked here and there, eventually straying from a great AP build. If that were the case, any champion with somewhat significant changes would be refunded (every single champ except a few newer ones). He's not even expensive, only 4800 IP. If you really have an issue with the meta changing, then you need to either keep up to date with all patches and content creators, closely monitoring each small shift with mages, or just dont play this game because every champ will be rotated in and out of play at some point. 

Remember the old days of Blue Ezreal, full AP Yi, and Deathfire Grasp Garen? Sometimes it's okay to have meta shifts, even if we dont always agree on them.

> [{quoted}](name=Melissa Crown,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=cdPxVfG3,comment-id=001b0000,timestamp=2017-09-26T21:39:56.661+0000)

If that were the case, any champion with somewhat significant changes would be refunded (every single champ except a few newer ones). He's not even expensive, only 4800 IP. If you really have an issue with the meta changing, then you need to either keep up to date with all patches and content creators, closely monitoring each small shift with mages, or just dont play this game because every champ will be rotated in and out of play at some point. 
> 
> Remember the old days of Blue Ezreal, full AP Yi, and Deathfire Grasp Garen? Sometimes it's okay to have meta shifts, even if we dont always agree on them.

Kog was made unviable as AP and when I bought him 1/3 of Kogs went AP Mid. This wasn't some gimmick build abusing just an item here or there. His kit has AP scalings on everything and he was played bot since launch. It seems really unfair to keep it in such a state. He was much like Karma... being able to go both mid and bot but unlike her, the AP style was totally unique in its playstyle. For my purposes, Kog was just deleted from the game and I bought him for no reason. What if your favorite champion was deleted from the role you play despite having a long history in that role? Would that seem OK to you?

He still has the same AP ratios, why do you think you can't play him AP? 
Because nobody else does?

I've been playing ashe support in order to prepare me for the janna rework, and I've got to say, it may not be very good but it sure is interactive! I can walk up and auto them and then the minions attack you, cucking your adc. its pretty fun! Given the fact that your nerfing janna's auto attack dmg and dmg scaling (by half), and the 'offset of this is that you get bonus dmg from movement speed (which you get less of from your new W), and your e cooldown is too valuable to waste on yourself for trading, I think ashe support will probably just be a better version of janna support! I'm excited to play more of it!
{{sticker:sg-janna}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

As an Azir main, I don't hate the new changes to him.  I would just like to say that, as a character that is not really in a strong spot, the nerfs to his kit aren't really good for the character.  What I am understanding is that these changes are supposed to emphasize on his mobility, but you reduce the range of his q, which actually hinders his mobility.  Also the reduced range on his active soldiers reduces how far he can jump with his e, so his mobility is even less.  While this isn't completely bad cause of his new w attack speed thing, for some reason his early game got a huge nerf (note that his new w attack speed won't be useful early game either), you remove his aoe attacks early on.  This character is a mess as of now, if you want to make him more mobile, decrease the cd on his e, and the new max distance thing is fine.  If you want him to have a balanced early game, he was pretty bad at that to begin with (not to mention the new range nerfs hurting it even more) so give him 100% aoe damage with soldiers at level 1.  Last of all, the ult change was completely unnecessary.
